class lib.obj_data.Project(name='Untitled')[source]¶

Bases: object

The top level of data structure. It contains general infomation and configuration of the project.

Variables

  • info (dict) – general infomation including name, file location, create time, last saved time.

  • files (List(FileData)) – files imported in this project.

  • ui_cong (dict) – user interface configuration.

get_path()[source]¶

Return absolute path of this project file location in user’s computer.

append_file(file)[source]¶

Append a file to this Project instance.

Parameters

file (FileData) – Given FileData instance.

delete_files(files)[source]¶

Delete specific files from this Project instance.

Parameters

files (List(FileData)) – A list of FileData instance.

clear_files()[source]¶

Clear all the files in this Project instance.

classmethod load_project(location=None)[source]¶

Retrieve project’s data from a computer file on specific location.

Parameters

location (Optional[str]) – The absolute path of a computer file(/.pkl).

dump(location=None)[source]¶

Save project’s data to computer file on specific location.

Parameters

location (Optional[str]) – The absolute path of a folder.

print()[source]¶

Print the infomation of this Project instance.

class lib.obj_data.FileData(name=None, source=None, file_path=None, import_time=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

The 2nd level of data structure. It contains general infomation of an imported files.

Variables

  • info (Dict) – general infomation including name, source, file path, create time, last modified time.

  • testnames (List(str)) – a list of all testnames.

  • valid_testnames (List(str)) – a list of testnames that is visible and operatable in app, which is customized by user.

  • measurements (Dict) – user interface configuration.

get_import_time()[source]¶

Return imported time of this FileData instance.

append_measurement(m_idx, measurement)[source]¶

Append a measurement to this FileData instance.

Parameters

  • m_idx (int) – Index of the measurement.

  • measurement (Measurement) – Given Measurement instance.

print()[source]¶

Print the infomation of this FileData instance.

class lib.obj_data.Measurement(channel_count=1, id=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

The 3rd level of data structure.

Variables

  • id (int) – index of this measurement.

  • channel (List(Channel)) – a list of Channel instances in this Measurement instance.

init_channels(count)[source]¶

Create given numbers of Channel instances for this Measurement instance.

Parameters

count (int) – Total numbers of channels.

print(console=True)[source]¶

Print the infomation.

class lib.obj_data.Channel(measurement_obj=None, id=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

The 4th level of data structure.

Variables

  • measurement_obj (Measurement) – The Measurement instance this Channel instance belongs to.

  • id (int) – Channel’s id.

  • sequence (Dict) – A dictionary of testname and its corresponding CurveData instance.

print(console=True)[source]¶

Print the infomation.

class lib.obj_data.CurveData(xdata, ydata, channel_obj, label='Curve', note='', _type=<CurveType.NoType: 'None'>, units=[])[source]¶

Bases: object

The bottom (5th) level of data structure.

Variables

  • channel_obj (Channel) – The Channel instance this CurveData instance belongs to.

  • xdata (List(float)) – Curve’s data of x-axis.

  • ydata (List(float)) – Curve’s data of y-axis.

  • label (str) – Curve’s label.

  • note (str) – Curve’s note.

  • _type (CurveType) – Curve’s data category.

  • units (List(str)) – Units of xdata and ydata.

  • shifted (float) – Recorded offset value.

  • line (matplotlib.lines.Line2D) – Matplolib Line2D object created by this CurveData instance.

  • line_props (Dict) – style properties of line.

get_legend(legend_wrap)[source]¶

Return the legend wrapped with a given characters long.

Parameters

legend_wrap (int) – A given number .

create_line2D(canvas, ax_id, order, legend_wrap, color=None, linewidth=1.5)[source]¶

Plot a curve on given canvas’s axis with specific order, text-wrap and color.

Parameters

  • canvas (matplotlib.figure) – Given matplot figure.

  • ax_id (int) – Id of axis.

  • order (int) – Figure would plot each curve by this order.

  • color (str) – Curve’s color.

  • linewidth (float) – Curve’s linewidth.

shift(offset)[source]¶

Shift ydata with given offset, which is always compared with the original data. That is, if the given offset is zero, it would be the original curve.

Parameters

offset (float) – Given offset.

align(targetDB, freq)[source]¶

Shift the curve to align given magnitude at given frequency.

Parameters

  • targetDB (float) – The target y-magnitude to align.

  • freq (float) – The target x-magnitude to align.

print(console=True)[source]¶

Print the infomation.

Main Window and Dialog¶

mainwindow.py¶

class lib.mainwindow.MainWindow(app, project_path=None)[source]¶

Bases: PyQt5.QtWidgets.QMainWindow

Variables

  • app (MyApp) – Object MyApp.

  • project (Project) –

    A Mainwindow object contains only one Project object.

    It is the data base.

  • menutopbar (MyMenuBar) –

  • wg_canvas (MyCanvas) –

    A self-defined QWidget component placed on the center of the mainwindow.

    It contains most of the ploting functions.

  • dwg_data (DockWidget_Data) –

    A self-defined QDockWidget placed on the left area by default.

    It contains a list of imported files and several functions interacting with the canvases in wg_canvas.

  • dwg_canvasLayout (DockWidget_CanvasLayout) –

    A self-defined QDockWidget placed on the left area by default.

    It contains functions of switching canvas layout mode, customizing canvas setting and post-processing.

initUI()[source]¶

Initial mainwindow’s user interface base on data in attribute project.

btn_processingDlg_handleClicked()[source]¶

This function connect with QPushButton component in dockwg_canvas.

When the button is clicked, execute Dlg_Operation and pop up a dialog window.

btn_axis_setting_handleClicked()[source]¶

This function connect with QPushButton component btn_axis_setting.

When the button is clicked, execute Dlg_AxisSetting and pop up a dialog window.

It is used for customizing which curve types CurveType would be drawn on a canvas. Each canvas has main axis and sub axis.

After dialog window closed, update related component with new setting.

append_file(file)[source]¶

Append a new imported file to attributes project, and also to the list in DockWidget component dwg_data.

Parameters

file (FileData) – A FileData object generated from the imported file.

delete_files(filenames_to_del)[source]¶

Delete files from attributes project, and also the data on the list in DockWidget component dwg_data.

Parameters

file (FileData) – A FileData object user intends to delete.

clear_files()[source]¶

Delete all the files in attributes project, and also clear curves data on the treelist in DockWidget component dwg_data.

save_file()[source]¶

Save project to file.

If this project is “Untitled”, which is the default name for a new project, it would execute QFileDialog with a dialog window popping up. User can determain a new name and where to save.

Otherwise, it would be updated to the origin project file.

save_file_as()[source]¶

Execute QFileDialog and pop up a dialog window letting user to determain a new name and where to save.

dlg_advance_selector.py¶

class lib.dlg_advance_selector.Dlg_AdvancedSelector(wg_file=None)[source]¶

Bases: PyQt5.QtWidgets.QDialog

A dialog assists user to customize each Wg_File properties. With given number n, user can also check or uncheck every n-th Wg_Curve instance of the list beginning and ending at given index.

Variables

wg_file (Wg_File) – The Wg_File instance that this dialog applys to.

initUI()[source]¶

Initial User Interface.

dlg_axis_setting.py¶

class lib.dlg_axis_setting.Dlg_AxisSetting(mainwindow=None)[source]¶

Bases: PyQt5.QtWidgets.QDialog

Variables

  • mainwindow (MainWindow) – The mainwindow object that triggers this dialog window.

  • form_parameter (dict) –

initUI()[source]¶

Initial dialog’s user interface.

cb_axis_handleTextChanged(event, canvas_id, ax_id)[source]¶

This function connect with all QComboBox components of the form in the dialog. It will be triggered when any comboBox’s option is changed.

Actually, it is not allowed to have same options on different comboBoxes except ‘None’ option. Every two options would automatically switch their positions if one of those is changed.

Parameters

  • event (str) – Current option text which is a CurveType name

  • canvas_id (int) – The index of the canvas that need to modify its axis’ CurveType

  • ax_id (int) – The axis index that need to modify its CurveType. 0 is main axis, 1 is sub axis.

class lib.dlg_graph_properties.Dlg_GraphProperties(mainwindow)[source]¶

Bases: PyQt5.QtWidgets.QDialog

A dialog for user to customize setting for current focusing canvas.

Variables

  • filepool (QWidget) – A widget component contains a list of Wg_File instances with all imported data.

  • canvas (QWidget) – The main canvas area of the window.

  • parameter (Dict) – A dictionary with the same key structure with general configuration FIGURE_CONF, but stores PyQt components as values instead.

dlg_operation.py¶

class lib.dlg_operation.Dlg_Operation(mainwindow=None)[source]¶

Bases: PyQt5.QtWidgets.QDialog

A dialog for user to apply post-processing operation to curves. Support uniary operation: Shift and Align.

Variables

  • mainwindow (MainWindow) – The MainWindow instance this dialog belongs to.

  • canvas (MyCanvasItem) – Current focusing canvas of the mainwindow.

initUI()[source]¶

Initial User Interface.

curve_offset()[source]¶

Shift those urves user select by given magnitude (y-axis).

curve_align()[source]¶

Align those urves user select to a given maginitude (y-axis) at given frequency (x-axis).

curve_reset()[source]¶

Remove all curves’ offset and reset to their original data.

UI Components¶

wg_canvas.py¶

class lib.wg_canvas.MyCanvasItem(parent=None, id=None, types=[], params={'Axis': {'Sub_Y-Axis': {'auto-scale': True, 'label': '', 'max': 100, 'min': 0, 'scale': 'log', 'unit': 'dBSPL'}, 'X-Axis': {'auto-scale': False, 'label': 'Frequency', 'max': 20000, 'min': 20, 'scale': 'log', 'unit': 'Hz'}, 'Y-Axis': {'auto-scale': True, 'label': '', 'max': 100, 'min': 0, 'scale': 'log', 'unit': 'dBSPL'}}, 'General': {'Legend': {'text-wrap': 25, 'visible': True}, 'Margin': {'left-right': 10, 'top-bottom': 10}, 'Title': ''}})[source]¶

Bases: matplotlib.backends.backend_qt5agg.FigureCanvasQTAgg

Self-defined Matplot Figure object.

Variables

  • title (str) – Canvas titel, use axis CurveType by default

  • id (int) – Canvas id

  • parameter (dict) – Canvas setting parameter

  • wg_canvas (MyCanvas) – Its parent, a QWidget that contains canvas layout and toolbar.

  • fig (matplotlib.pyplot.figure) –

  • ax_main (matplotlib.pyplot.Axes) – main y-axis on fig

  • ax_sub (matplotlib.pyplot.Axes) – sub y-axis on fig, share the same x-axis with main ax_main

  • draggable_lines (Draggable_lines) – A set of horizontal and vertical lines that can be drag by mouse movement. Use for highlighting a specific coordinate.

  • ax_types (List[CurveType]) – A list that contains 2 element, both main and sub axis’ data type.

  • grid_status (List[Bool]) – A list records current visibility status of both main and sub axis’ grid.

clear_lines(ax_id)[source]¶

Clear all the line on the given y-axis, while avoid deleting the draggable lines, which is the frist two line in ax_main (axis’ id = 0).

Parameters

ax_idx (int) – Either 0 or 1. It is used as the index for accessing specific axis on the figure.

apply_style()[source]¶

Apply parameters to this MyCanvasItem instance.

get_ax(curveType)[source]¶

If canvas has any axis’s type in line with the input parameter curveType, return axis id and axis instance. Otherwise, return (-1, None).

Parameters

curveType (CurveType) –

get_name()[source]¶

Return a string contains its axis types.

set_grid_status(status=None)[source]¶
toggle_ax_grid(ax_id, status)[source]¶
replot()[source]¶

Replot the canvas.

update_title()[source]¶

Update canvas’s title.

autoscale(ax_idx)[source]¶

Autoscale given y-axis.

Parameters

ax_idx (int) – Either 0 or 1. It is used as the index for accessing specific axis on the figure.

handleDoubleClicked(event)[source]¶

If User double clicked on this canvas, change this canvas to be the focusing canvas.

toggle_focus_style(focus)[source]¶

Only one focusing canvas instance in an application. Focusing canvas instance have a highlight border.

Parameters

focus (bool) – given focus status to toggle and modify this MyCanvasItem instance’s displaying style.

handle_click(event)[source]¶
dragEnterEvent(event)[source]¶

Triggered when User drag the canvas label in left dockwidget on this canvas instance.

dropEvent(event)[source]¶

Triggered when User drop the canvas label in left dockwidget on this canvas instance. Modifying canvas layout according to user’s options.

reset_linewidth()[source]¶

Set linewidth of all curves on the canvas to default value.

class lib.wg_canvas.MyCanvas(mainwindow=None)[source]¶

Bases: PyQt5.QtWidgets.QWidget

Self-defined QWidget containing a toolbar and multiple MyCanvasItem. The layout inside it can adjust by user at the run time.

Variables

  • mainwindow (MainWindow) – The MainWindow instance that this MyCanvas instance belongs to.

  • canvasPool (List[MyCanvasItem]) – A list of MyCanvasItem.

  • mode (str) –

    current canvas layout mode.

    Support mode main, up and down for ver_0.2.0.

  • status (Dict) – Store the mode and its canvas arrangement as a dictionary.

  • toolbar (MyToolBar) – A MyToolBar instance.

initUI()[source]¶

Initial User Interface.

replot()[source]¶

Replot all the canvas instances in the list canvasPool.

change_focusing_canvas(focusing_canvas)[source]¶

Change current focusing canvas, only one at a time. Modify the displaying style and also change toolbar’s target canvas.

set_mode(mode)[source]¶

Set canvas layout mode.

get_canvas(_type=None, id=None)[source]¶

Return a MyCanvasItem with given id or given axis’ CurveType.

Removing Wg_File instances with given filenames from this Wg_FilePool instance.

Parameters

transfer_to_table()[source]¶

Return a table for graph properties’ dialog.

It contains curves under certain conditions, such as focusing canvas, valid tests, and link status of each Wg-File instances.

Columns includes: Label, Note, Data testname, Color, LineWidth.

transfer_to_list()[source]¶

Return a list for post processing dialog.

It contains curves is visible on the focusing canvas.
